page.title: 05WOODFALLS FARM LADDINGFORD
page.content: THE LAND COVER OF OUR AREA IS BASICALLY GRASSLAND AND ORCHARDS. ON VISITING WOODFALLS, WE DISCOVERED THAT WOODFALLS FARM USED TO BE A HOP FARM WITH THE HOP MARKETING BOARD - IN USE UNTIL ABOUT 15 YEARS AGO WHEN BUSINESS WAS DISCONTINUED DUE TO THE DEATH OF THE OWNER. IT WAS THEN TAKEN OVER AS A PRIVATE FARM AND COMMERCIAL BUSINESS. PART OF THE FARMLAND IS CULTIVATED AND GROWS CORN. ANOTHER PART OF THE FARM IS ROUGH GRAZING FOR HORSES AND BULLOCKS WHICH ARE FATTENED FOR BEEF. 6 HORSES ARE FED AND GROOMED DAILY AND CARED FOR HERE AND THEN TAKEN IN HORSE BOXES TO THE MEET AND USED FOR HUNTING. PART OF THE RIVER MEDWAY RUNS THROUGH WOODFALLS FARM.
